item.description: 2nd Panzer Division Unit Insignia: Equipment: Anti-tank Bn: JpPz-IV Tanks: PZ-IV , PZ-V (Panther) 12/11/1943 Division was sent to France for refitting after the heavy losses it suffered on the Eastern Front 8/03/1944 Refitting and replacements have gone well. Divisional commander was personally praised by the Inspector General of Armoured Troops, Heinz Guderian (a previous […]
item.content:encoded:
2nd Panzer Division Unit Insignia:

Equipment:

Anti-tank Bn: JpPz-IV
Tanks: PZ-IV , PZ-V (Panther)

12/11/1943 Division was sent to France for refitting after the heavy losses it suffered on the Eastern Front

8/03/1944 Refitting and replacements have gone well. Divisional commander was personally praised by the Inspector General of Armoured Troops, Heinz Guderian (a previous commander of the unit) for its overall effectiveness during training exercises.

item.title: 2nd SS Panzer Division

item.description: 2nd SS Panzer Division Unit Insignia: Honorific: ‘Das Reich’ Equipment: Tanks: PZ-IV x55 and PZ-V (Panther) x37 Assault Gun Bn: StuG-III x42

2nd SS Panzer Division Unit Insignia:

Honorific: ‘Das Reich’

Assault Gun Bn: StuG-III x42

item.title: 1st SS Panzer Division
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: 1st SS Panzer Division Unit Insignia: Honorific: ‘Leibstandarte SS Adolf Hitler’ Equipment: Tanks: PZ-IV x45 and PZ-V (Panther) x41 Assault Gun Bn: StuG-III x42 8/02/1944 The majority of the Division (41 officers and 1,188 men) remaining after the Battle of Kursk (on the Eastern Front), were withdrawn to Belgium for rest and refit. 25/04/1944 Division […]
item.content:encoded:
1st SS Panzer Division Unit Insignia:

Honorific: ‘Leibstandarte SS Adolf Hitler’
Equipment:

Tanks: PZ-IV x45 and PZ-V (Panther) x41
Assault Gun Bn: StuG-III x42

8/02/1944 The majority of the Division (41 officers and 1,188 men) remaining after the Battle of Kursk (on the Eastern Front), were withdrawn to Belgium   for rest and refit.

25/04/1944 Division now at full strength. Attached to I Panzer Corps with  SS Division Hitlerjugend and the Panzer Lehr Division.

item.title: 116th Panzer Division
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: 116th Panzer Division Unit Insignia: Equipment: Tanks: PZ-III, PZ-IV (waiting for Panther) Anti-Tank Bn: StuG-III Arty: 1 x Bty Sch Kan 18 10/04/1944 Formed in Germany from the remnants of the 16th Panzergrenadier Division (withdrawn from Eastern Front), and located with the 179th Reserve Panzer Division, based in Northern France. Under the command of Colonel Günther von Manteuffel […]
item.content:encoded:
116th Panzer Division Unit Insignia:

Equipment:

Tanks: PZ-III, PZ-IV (waiting for Panther)
Anti-Tank Bn: StuG-III
Arty: 1 x Bty Sch Kan 18

10/04/1944 Formed in Germany from the remnants of the 16th Panzergrenadier Division (withdrawn from Eastern Front),  and located with the 179th Reserve Panzer Division, based in Northern France. Under the command of Colonel Günther von Manteuffel

01/05/1944 General  Gerhard Graf von Schwerin appointed as commander

03/05/1944 I Bn/16 Panzer Regiment is refitting in Germany. II Bn/16 Panzer Regiment has 12 tanks in repair

item.title: 12th SS Panzer Division
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: 12th SS Panzer Division Unit Insignia: Honorific: ‘Hitlerjugend’ Equipment: Tanks: PZ-IV x55 and PZ-V (Panther) x37 Anti-tank Bn: JpPz-IV + Marder III Notes: 30/9/43: Raised from Hitler Youth, with core of officers and NCOs from 1 SS Panzer Division. 12/3/44: Attached to 1 Panzer Corps (France)
item.content:encoded:
12th SS Panzer Division Unit Insignia:

Honorific: ‘Hitlerjugend’

Equipment:

Tanks: PZ-IV x55 and PZ-V (Panther) x37
Anti-tank Bn: JpPz-IV + Marder III

Notes:

30/9/43: Raised from Hitler Youth, with core of officers and NCOs from 1 SS Panzer Division.

12/3/44: Attached to 1 Panzer Corps (France)

item.title: Panzer Lehr
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Panzer Lehr Unit Insignia: Equipment: Tanks: PZ-IV , PZ-V (Panther), PZ-VI (Tiger) Anti-tank Bn: JpPz-IV, Sd.Kfz.234 (wheeled) Arty: SP Marder I (‘Lorraine’) Collator’s note: Panzer Lehr is an elite Wehrmacht unit so its equipment quality and numbers will be higher than other Wehrmacht divisions 02/02/1944 All Panzergrenadier Regiments have been equipped with Sd.Kfz.234 half-tracks to […]
item.content:encoded:
Panzer Lehr Unit Insignia:

Equipment:

Tanks: PZ-IV , PZ-V (Panther), PZ-VI (Tiger)
Anti-tank Bn: JpPz-IV, Sd.Kfz.234 (wheeled)
Arty: SP Marder I (‘Lorraine’)

Collator’s note: Panzer Lehr is an elite Wehrmacht unit so its equipment quality and numbers will be higher than other Wehrmacht divisions

02/02/1944 All Panzergrenadier Regiments have been equipped with Sd.Kfz.234 half-tracks to replace trucks as troop transporters. This is the first divisionto achieve this

15/03/1944 316 Pzr Coy received the first 10 x Tiger I tanks, but a further 5 Tiger II tanks have not arrived due to mechanical failures.

17/04/1944 Allocated to the strategic reserve, Panzer Group West.

item.title: 21st Panzer Division
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: 21st Panzer Division Unit Insignia: Equipment: Tanks: PZ-IV and Somua S35 Assault Gun Bn: 7.5/105cm Geschutzwagen 39H(f) Artillery: 10.5/15cm LeFH Lorraine; Somua MCL multi-rocket launcher 7/07/1943 Division reconstituted in France (captured / defeated in North Africa in May 1943). 20/07/1943 Division is now under the command of Rommel, who is responsible for German forces from […]
item.content:encoded:
21st Panzer Division Unit Insignia:

Equipment:

Tanks: PZ-IV and Somua S35
Assault Gun Bn: 7.5/105cm Geschutzwagen 39H(f)
Artillery: 10.5/15cm LeFH Lorraine; Somua MCL multi-rocket launcher

7/07/1943 Division reconstituted in France (captured / defeated in North Africa in May 1943).

20/07/1943 Division is now  under the command of Rommel, who is responsible for German forces from the Netherlands to the Loire.

8/10/1943 Division is using French army vehicles adapted and upgraded at a conversion facility near Paris called ‘Baukommando Becker’
